org.cloudbus.cloudsim.power

Class PowerVmAllocationPolicyMigrationAbstract

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cloudbus.cloudsim.allocationpolicies.VmAllocationPolicyAbstract
      • org.cloudbus.cloudsim.power.PowerVmAllocationPolicyAbstract
        • org.cloudbus.cloudsim.power.PowerVmAllocationPolicyMigrationAbstract
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VmAllocationPolicy, PowerVmAllocationPolicy, PowerVmAllocationPolicyMigration
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PowerVmAllocationPolicyMigrationInterQuartileRange, PowerVmAllocationPolicyMigrationLocalRegression, PowerVmAllocationPolicyMigrationMedianAbsoluteDeviation, PowerVmAllocationPolicyMigrationStaticThreshold

    public abstract class PowerVmAllocationPolicyMigrationAbstract
extends PowerVmAllocationPolicyAbstract
implements PowerVmAllocationPolicyMigration
    An abstract power-aware VM allocation policy that dynamically optimizes the VM allocation (placement) using migration.

    If you are using any algorithms, policies or workload included in the power package please cite the following paper:

    • Anton Beloglazov, and Rajkumar Buyya, "Optimal Online Deterministic Algorithms and Adaptive Heuristics for Energy and Performance Efficient Dynamic Consolidation of Virtual Machines in Cloud Data Centers", Concurrency and Computation: Practice and Experience (CCPE), Volume 24, Issue 13, Pages: 1397-1420, John Wiley & Sons, Ltd, New York, USA, 2012
    Since:
    CloudSim Toolkit 3.0
    Author:
    Anton Beloglazov

    • Method Detail

      • optimizeAllocation

        public Map<Vm,Host> optimizeAllocation(List<? extends Vm> vmList)
        Description copied from interface: VmAllocationPolicy
        Optimize allocation of the VMs according to current utilization.
        Specified by:
        optimizeAllocation in interface VmAllocationPolicy
        Parameters:
        vmList - the vm list
        Returns:
        the new vm placement list, where each item is a map where the key is the first item is the VM and the second is the host where it has to be placed. The map key is just to identify if the map item is the VM or Host

      • findHostForVm

        public PowerHostSimple findHostForVm(Vm vm,
                                     Set<? extends Host> excludedHosts)
        Finds a PM that has enough resources to host a given VM and that will not be overloaded after placing the VM on it. The selected host will be that one with most efficient power usage for the given VM.
        Parameters:
        vm - the VM
        excludedHosts - the excluded hosts
        Returns:
        the host found to host the VM

      • isHostOverUtilizedAfterAllocation

        protected boolean isHostOverUtilizedAfterAllocation(PowerHostSimple host,
                                                    Vm vm)
        Checks if a host will be over utilized after placing of a candidate VM.
        Parameters:
        host - the host to verify
        vm - the candidate vm
        Returns:
        true, if the host will be over utilized after VM placement; false otherwise

      • getNewVmPlacement

        protected Map<Vm,Host> getNewVmPlacement(List<Vm> vmsToMigrate,
                                         Set<Host> excludedHosts)
        Gets a new vm placement considering the list of VM to migrate.
        Parameters:
        vmsToMigrate - the list of VMs to migrate
        excludedHosts - the list of hosts that aren't selected as destination hosts
        Returns:
        the new vm placement map where each key is a Vm and each value is the host to place it.

      • getPowerAfterAllocation

        protected double getPowerAfterAllocation(PowerHostSimple host,
                                         Vm vm)
        Gets the power consumption of a host after placement of a candidate VM. The VM is not in fact placed at the host.
        Parameters:
        host - the host
        vm - the candidate vm
        Returns:
        the power after allocation

      • getMaxUtilizationAfterAllocation

        protected double getMaxUtilizationAfterAllocation(PowerHostSimple host,
                                                  Vm vm)
        Gets the max power consumption of a host after placement of a candidate VM. The VM is not in fact placed at the host. We assume that load is balanced between PEs. The only restriction is: VM's max MIPS < PE's MIPS
        Parameters:
        host - the host
        vm - the vm
        Returns:
        the power after allocation

        Returns:
